Sentencas: A two-cell planar stack in the Julich F-design with solid oxide cells has been built and the reversible operation between fuel cell and electrolysis modes has been demonstrated.
Titulo: Long-term tests of a Julich planar short stack with reversible solid oxide cells in both fuel cell and electrolysis modes

Sentencas: The cells were anode supported cells (ASC) with yttria-stabilized zirconia (YSZ) electrolytes, Ni/YSZ hydrogen electrodes and perovskite oxygen electrodes with lanthanum strontium cobalt ferrite (LSCF).
Titulo: Long-term tests of a Julich planar short stack with reversible solid oxide cells in both fuel cell and electrolysis modes

Sentencas: This paper summarizes and discusses the preliminary experimental results on the long-term aging tests of the reversible solid oxide planar short stack for fuel cell operation (4000 h) at a current density of 0.5 A cm(-2) which shows a degradation of 0.6% per 1000 h and for steam electrolysis operation (3450 h) and co-electrolysis operation of CO2 and H2O (640 h) under different current densities from -0.3 to -0.875 A cm(-2) which show different degradation rates depending on current density and on steam or co-electrolysis.
Titulo: Long-term tests of a Julich planar short stack with reversible solid oxide cells in both fuel cell and electrolysis modes
